TOPwh is the result of a practical project realized during the course of the lecture Geometría Computacional at the Universidad Politécnica de Madrid.

 

The idea behind the program

The task has been to write a program capable of triangulating polygons with holes. The program's name is derived from this task: Triangulation Of Polygons with holes... Please forgive that lack of creativity ;-)

To achieve the goal of this task, the program consists of mainly two big parts: The GUI functionality and implementations of algorithms from the field of computational geometry. Whereas the GUI provides some comfortable methods of drawing and editing polygons, the mathematical aspects of this program are its capabilities to located polygons in reference to each other, connect them without intersections and finally triangulate them.

 

The content of this documentation

This help document is not meant to be a technical documentation of the program code. It's the end-user help which tells you how to use the program and besides, tries to give a little insight in the mathematics behind the scenes. Furthermore this help gives hints on the limitations of the program, possible improvements as well as related topics.

Basically this help document consists of two parts:

  1. The GUI description and explanation
  2. Information about the algorithms used to achieve the programs goal
